page.title: 12MOFFAT REMEMBERED
page.content: Mrs Boyd a resident of Moffat for more than fifty years,considers it a privilege to be able to live in Moffat because of its scenic beauty, historical interest,and friendly, caring community. She regrets the loss of the railway from Moffat and Beattock because it meant the loss of jobs and caused inconvenience to travellers,who now have to travel to Lockerbie which is a pick-up point for journeys,north or south. She notices the increasing volume of road traffic but realises it is necessary to bring tourists to the town. She remembers the time when Moffat had a very wide High Street which was the envy of other towns. Unfortunately it has been split in two and in the middle a car parking area built.This leads to congestion but allows people to park near the shops.
